column4: when I run a xbuntu livecd, it run and loaded. but when I chos INSTALL, it stops at 86%. But when I install it on anothe computer, it installs fine.  Does this mean my notebook cannot install or support Ubuntu?
use the install dvd/cd's the live ones suck...they compleatly messed up my partion table and messed everything up
or at least use the "text" based installer on the live dvd
so i should download and install the proper kbuntu cd?
yes if it is kde(kubuntu) you want to use. or use the text based installer.....that worked for me
the text based installer?
where can I download the 6.10 kbuntu and ubuntu?
yea put in the dvd.reboot.when it starts the dvd...it should ask do you wan to.......and hopefully there should be a option with somthing about text
so just because the xbuntu livecd didnt install, doesnt mean my notebook cant install ubuntu?
no no......if you want xubuntu dl the xubuntu cd.
the live dvd/cd will start?..and just not install?...or
the xbuntu livecd starts and works fine.  but when I chose INSTALL, then it stops at 86%
yea then *ubuntu WILL work.
so where cna I download 6.10 full ubuntu install CD?
just see if there is a text based installer on the dvd/cd if not dl the install version..the live one isnt too good at installing
try gogole
i dont have alink on hand
why would the xbuntu liveCD install fine on other systems, but not mine?
whats gogole?
luck of the draw...diff hardware
lol google.com
so yea...i had the same issue so dont get discouraged :-)
